item.title: Kai Dinghofer
item.description: … besides being a free-minded software engineer, I am also a regular human! I like to travel, take photos and crusing with my skateboard(s) whenever it is possible. Other hobbies include (but are not limited to) running, hiking and of course: diving. While I love communicating and intuitively connecting with people, it is an equal important part of me having the possibility to relax my mind exploring the world’s wonderful nature.

item.title: Bachelor Thesis
item.description: About one year after my Bachelor graduation, I asked myself: Why shouldn’t other people have the possibility to read my thesis? In my work, I analyzed how well the Ethereum Blockchain can be integrated into exisiting business processes of the FH Aachen. As a business process execution engine, I used the Open-Source Camunda BPM and wrote an own web3-connector to communicate with self-developed Smart Contracts. If you like my thesis, please consider a â˜• donation to my Ethereum address:

item.title: Master Thesis
item.description: In my master’s thesis, I took a deep dive into the data science world and the emerging field of Reciprocal Recommender Systems (RRSs) which enable Human-to-Human recommendations. I engineered Chaos, a first of its kind framework that aims to build a solid bridge between the research and development departments of RRSs.

item.title: Hugo Community Mods
item.description: A GitHub organization dedicated to High-Quality Hugo modules, some of them include: lazyimg: Responsive lazy image loading module with superpowers. Automatically resizes assets, with LQIP and WebP support (plus sane fallback). icons: SVG symbol icon system, collects only the icons you really use on your site. Designed to be flexible and extensible. Finally, an icon module that scales. release-notify: Notifies the user whenever a new module release is available.

item.title: Pyotek
item.description: Pyotek is an organization that is still building up. Let’s see what the future will bring. Fow now, you can check out the official non-profit tech-blog! ðŸ“°

item.title: About
item.description: I am a free-minded and passionate software engineer, tech enthusiast and maker, who never stops developing and evolving: You can call me kdevo, too. By the start of 2021, I’ve finished my M.Eng. in Information Systems Engineering at the FH Aachen, where I took a deep dive into the emerging field of Reciprocal Recommender Systems from a research and practical point of view. Bringing these two views together, you can now read my published thesis or experiment with Chaos, a first of its kind framework for researching human-to-human recommendations.
